name: Jane Smith
bio: Jane Smith is a renowned executive chef with over 10 years of experience in the culinary industry.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Bolognese
recipes.method: 1. Cook spaghetti according to package directions. 2. Brown ground beef in a skillet. 3. Add chopped onion and garlic and cook until softened. 4. Add canned tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes. 5. Serve sauce over spaghetti.

recipes.name: Roast Chicken
recipes.method: 1. Preheat oven to 400F. 2. Rinse chicken and pat dry. 3. Rub butter under the skin and all over the chicken. 4. Stuff the chicken with garlic, lemon, and thyme. 5. Roast for 1 hour or until fully cooked. 6. Let rest for 10 minutes before carving.

recipes.name: Beef Stir Fry
recipes.method: 1. Cook rice according to package directions. 2. Brown beef strips in a skillet. 3. Add sliced bell pepper and onion and cook until softened. 4. Add soy sauce and cook for 5 minutes. 5. Serve over rice.

name: Juan Rodriguez
bio: Juan Rodriguez is a skilled head chef and he has worked in some of the finest restaurants in Los Angeles.

recipes.name: Classic Beef Stroganoff
recipes.method: In a large skillet, cook beef until browned. Remove beef and set aside. Add onion and garlic to skillet and cook until softened. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Sprinkle flour over vegetables and stir to combine. Gradually add beef broth and bring to a simmer. Return beef to skillet and simmer until sauce thickens. Stir in sour cream and season with salt and pepper. Serve over cooked egg noodles.

recipes.name: Crispy Fried Chicken
recipes.method: In a large bowl, whisk together buttermilk and hot sauce. Add chicken pieces and stir to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight. In a shallow dish, whisk together flour, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Remove chicken from buttermilk and dredge in flour mixture, shaking off excess. In a large, deep skillet, heat about 1 inch of oil over medium-high heat. Fry chicken in batches until golden brown and cooked through, about 10-12 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels and serve.

recipes.name: Classic Meatloaf
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 375°F. In a large bowl, mix together ground beef, breadcrumbs, onion, milk, egg, Worcestershire sauce, Dijon mustard, garlic powder, salt, and pepper until well combined. Transfer mixture to a greased loaf pan and spread ketchup over the top. Bake for 1 hour or until meatloaf is cooked through. Let cool for 5-10 minutes before slicing and serving.
